namelist_definition.entry: Clumps per processor.
Atmospheric CO2 molar ratio (by volume) (umol/mol)
Type of CO2 feedback.
Visible and Near-infrared albedo's for glacier ice
If true, river runoff will be split up into liquid and ice streams, otherwise ice runoff will be zero and all runoff directed to liquid stream
If true, and CLMCN carbon-nitrogen model is on, Nitrogen will be prescribed rather than prognosed
If true, harvesting will be scaled according to coeffecients determined by Johann Feddema, 2009
Flag to separate the vegetated landunit into a crop landunit and a natural vegetation landunit
Set to true to turn on multiple elevation classes over glacier points. Normally this is ONLY used when running CCSM with the active glacier model. Only works when GLC_NEC is greater than zero.

Set to true to calculate surface mass balance for glacier multi-elevation class points. Set to false to use growing degree day information for glaciers multi-elevation class points. Only works when create_glacier_mec_landunit is true. (Only tested with glc_smb=.true. when create_glacier_mec_landunit is .true., setting it to .false. is NOT tested)
Set to true to dynamically change topographic height over glacier points. Only works when create_glacier_mec_landunit is true. (EXPERIMENTAL AND NOT FUNCTIONAL!)
Flag to output NetCDF files in 64-bit large-file format
Time step (seconds)
Override the start type from the driver: 3: branch

Flag to use Nitrogen Deposition files from streams or not If .true. will use Nitrogen Deposition files from streams and interpolate to output resolution If .false. will use fndepdat and fndepdyn files, which MUST be on the output resolution
Full pathname of atmosphere grid data file.
Input archive device prefix to retrieve input files from (used by shr/shr_file_mod.F90) (such as mss: for NCAR mass store)
Full pathname of landfrac data file (on atm grid).
Full pathname of atmosphere topography data file (on atm grid).
Full pathname of land-ice mask data file (on lnd grid).
Full pathname of initial conditions file.
Full pathname of land topography file.
Full pathname of nitrogen deposition data file.
Full pathname of dynamic nitrogen deposition data file.
Full pathname of plant function type (PFT) constants
Full pathname of time varying PFT data file.
Full pathname of input datafile for rtm.
Full pathname of surface data file.
Aerosol deposition file name (when NOT passing deposition rates from atmosphere model)
SNICAR (SNow, ICe, and Aerosol Radiative model) optical data file name
SNICAR (SNow, ICe, and Aerosol Radiative model) snow aging data file name
Per file averaging flag. 'A' (average over history period) 'I' (instantaneous) 'X' (maximum over history period) 'M' (minimum over history period)
Averaging of output for 1D vector output
Frequency to generate initial dataset. 'NONE'.
TRUE implies do grid averaging. One setting per history file.
TRUE indicates no default history fields.
Fields to exclude from history file 1.
Fields to exclude from history file 2.
Fields to exclude from history file 3.
Fields to exclude from history file 4.
Fields to exclude from history file 5.
Fields to exclude from history file 6.
Fields to add to history file 1.
Fields to add to history file 2.
Fields to add to history file 3.
Fields to add to history file 4.
Fields to add to history file 5.
Fields to add to history file 6.
Per file maximum number of time samples.
Per file history file density (i.e. output precision) (1=double precision, 2=single precision) Default: 2,2,2,2,2,2
Per file history write frequency in steps if positive, (0=monthly), negative means hours Default: 0,-24,-24,-24,-24,-24
Full pathname of master restart file for branch run.
number of segments per clump for decomposition Default: 20
Perturbation limit when doing error growth test
FALSE implies don't write any restart files.
If greater than one, average rtm over rtm_nsteps time steps

Turn urban air conditioning/heating ON or OFF and add wasteheat OFF = Air conditioning/heating is OFF in buildings, internal temperature allowed to float freely ON = Air conditioning/heating is ON in buildings, internal temperature constrained ON_WASTEHEAT = Air conditioning/heating is ON and waste-heat sent to urban canyon
TRUE if want urban traffic flux (Currently NOT implemented)
TRUE if want diagnostic of global radiative temperature written to CLM log file
Plant Function Type dataset for mksurfdata
Historical greenhouse gas concentrations from CAM
TRUE if want to use PIO to write history data out (EXPERIMENTAL AND NOT FUNCTIONAL!)
TRUE if want to turn on low memory 2d writes in clm hist (EXPERIMENTAL AND NOT FUNCTIONAL!)
TRUE if want default pio use setting (EXPERIMENTAL AND NOT FUNCTIONAL!)
TRUE if want to use MCT as Rearranger (EXPERIMENTAL AND NOT FUNCTIONAL!)
TRUE if want to use box as Rearranger (EXPERIMENTAL AND NOT FUNCTIONAL!)
TRUE if want to write with pio serial netcdf mode (EXPERIMENTAL AND NOT FUNCTIONAL!)
Integer pio debug level (EXPERIMENTAL AND NOT FUNCTIONAL!)
Integer number of iotasks to use for PIO (EXPERIMENTAL AND NOT FUNCTIONAL!)
CASA Net Primary Production format: 1=gpp*gppfact,2=fn(lgrow)*gppfact (CASA is EXPERIMENTAL NOT SUPPORTED!) Default: 2
CASA allocation type: 0=fixed allocation, 1=dynamic allocation (CASA is EXPERIMENTAL NOT SUPPORTED!) Default: 1
CASA Temperature dependence (CASA is EXPERIMENTAL NOT SUPPORTED!) Default: 2.0
CASA flag if input file spunup or not: 0=no, 1=yes (CASA is EXPERIMENTAL NOT SUPPORTED!) Default: 0
CASA Carbon Pool initial state filename (CASA is EXPERIMENTAL NOT SUPPORTED!) Default: blank
First year to loop over for Nitrogen Deposition data
Last year to loop over for Nitrogen Deposition data
Simulation year that aligns with stream_year_first_ndep value
Filename of input stream data for Nitrogen Deposition
If true, run model in "aqua planet" mode. Only one of atm_adiabatic, atm_ideal_phys, or aqua_planet can be true.
If true, do not run model physics, only run the dynamical core. Only one of atm_adiabatic, atm_ideal_phys, or aqua_planet can be true.
If true run the idealized Held&Suarez physics package. Only one of atm_adiabatic, atm_ideal_phys, or aqua_planet can be true.
bit for bit flag
If true, use the pre-existing case name for a branch run.
Case title.
Case identifier. Normally used as part of the archive path name. By default also used in output filenames (see the hfilename_spec namelist option).
T => no diurnal cycle in ocn albedos. Default: FALSE
Selects E,P,R adjustment technique.
Debug flag. Default: 1
Postfix for output log files.
Couple ocean on atm timestep.
Earth's eccentricity of orbit. (unitless: typically 0. to 0.1). Setting is Required if orb_iyear_ad not set. Not used when running as part of CCSM.

Year (AD) used to compute earth's orbital parameters. If not set, then use the values from the orb_eccen, orb_mvelp, and orb_obliq namelist parameters. If only orb_iyear_ad is set, orbital parameters will be computed automatically (based on Berger, 1977). If one of orb_eccen, orb_mvelp, or orb_obliq is set, all three must be set. If all four of the above are set by the user, orb_iyear_ad takes precedence. Setting is Required unless orb_eccen, orb_mvelp, and orb_obliq are set. Not used when running as part of CCSM.
Earth's moving vernal equinox at perihelion (degrees: 0. to 360.0). Setting is Required if orb_iyear_ad not set. Not used when running as part of CCSM.
Earth's orbital angle of obliquity (degrees: -90. to +90., typically 22. to 26.). Setting is Required if orb_iyear_ad not set. Not used when running as part of CCSM.
Root output files
Set to TRUE to specify that the run will use a perpetual calendar, i.e., a diurnal cycle will be present for the fixed calendar day specified by perpetual_ymd.
Perpetual date encoded in an integer as (year*1000 + month*100 + day). If aqua_planet = .true. then perpetual_ymd is ignored and the perpetual date is set to 321.
Driver restart filename.
List of namelist variables that may be overridden on a restart run.
Driver restart pointer filename.
are atmosphere and ocean grids same lat/lon/size
are atmosphere and land grids same lat/lon/size
Latitude value of single column.
Longitude value of single column.
Set to TRUE to turn on single column mode.
Run type. 'startup' is an initial run. 'continue' is a restart run. 'branch' is a restart run in which properties of the output history files may be changed.
Model version.
Name of the machine you are running the model on.
Name of user running the model.
Change mapping in driver to give bit-for-bit results regardless of number of processors used.
Toggle to turn writing of budgets to log file on.
Output level for instantaneous budgets.
Output level for daily budgets.
Output level for monthly budgets.
Output level for annual budgets.
Output level for long-term annual budgets.
Output level for long-term budgets written at the end of the run.
Directory name to store timing files
Directory name to store timing checkpoint files
Tolerance to match fractional areas for each component: land, ice, and ocn.
Tolerance to match land and atmospheric grid cell latitudes and longitudes.
Tolerance to match land and atmospheric grid masks
Tolerance to match land and atmospheric grid areas
Stride used in selecting the processes in the atm communicator group.
Root process of the atm communicator group.
Number of atm tasks.
Number of threads in each atm task.
Stride used in selecting the processes in the lnd communicator group.
Root process of the lnd communicator group.
Number of lnd tasks.
Number of threads in each lnd task.
Stride used in selecting the processes in the ice communicator group.
Root process of the ice communicator group.
Number of ice tasks.
Number of threads in each ice task.
Stride used in selecting the processes in the ocn communicator group.
Root process of the ocn communicator group.
Number of ocn tasks.
Number of threads in each ocn task.
Stride used in selecting the processes in the glc communicator group.
Root process of the glc communicator group.
Number of glc tasks.
Number of threads in each glc task.
Stride used in selecting the processes in the cpl communicator group.
Root process of the cpl communicator group.
Number of cpl tasks.
Number of threads in each cpl task.
Coupling interval between the atmosphere and other system components. This is how frequently information can be communicated between the atmosphere and the surface models.
Controls phasing of the coupling with the atmosphere model. (seconds)

Calendar type "NO_LEAP" for consistent 365-days per year or "GREGORIAN" to include leap-years. Note that if "GREGORIAN" is selected leap-years will be used in the time manager, but the calculation of the earth's orbit still assumes 365 day years.
Write restart at end of run.
Controls phasing of the coupling with the sea-ice model. (seconds)
Controls phasing of the coupling with the land model. (seconds)
Controls phasing of the coupling with the ocean model. (seconds)
Reference time-of-day expressed as seconds past midnight. Used in conjuction with ref_ymd to set the reference time.

Reference date encoded in an integer as (year*1000 + month*100 + day). Used in conjuction with ref_tod to set the reference time which is used to define a time coordinate for the output history files. The convention for the unit string of a time coordinate is of the form "time-unit since reference-time", for example, "days since 1990-01-01 00:00:00". The reference-time part of this string is specified by the ref_ymd and ref_tod variables.
Set the restart interval as a number of elapsed time units which are specified by restart_option.

Set the interval between writing restart files using one of the options 'nsteps', 'ndays', 'nmonths', or 'nyears', in conjuction with stop_n to set the number of time units. A convenience option allows specifying that restart files be written at the end of each month or at the end of each year by using the options 'monthly' or 'yearly' respectively. It is also possible to request that no restart files be written via the option 'none', or that restart files be written only at the end of the run via the option 'end'.
Start time-of-day expressed as seconds past midnight. Used in conjuction with start_ymd to set the start time.
Start date encoded in an integer as (year*1000 + month*100 + day). Used in conjuction with start_tod to set the start date of the simulation.
Set the length of run as a number of elapsed time units which are specified by stop_option.

Set the length of run as an elapsed time using one of the options 'nsteps', 'ndays', 'nmonths', or 'nyears', in conjuction with stop_n to set the number of elapsed time units. Alternatively, set the final simulation time in absolute terms by using the option 'date' in conjuction with stop_ymd, and stop_tod to specify a date and time of day at which the simulation should stop.
Stop time-of-day expressed as seconds past midnight. Used in conjuction with stop_ymd to set the stop time.
Stop date encoded in an integer as (year*1000 + month*100 + day). Used in conjuction with stop_tod to set the stop date of the simulation.
Flag to turn on barriers before running a performance section.
Flag to turn all performance OFF or on.
Flag to send output to a single file (rather than separate files per MPI task).
integer indicating maximum number of levels of timer nesting.
integer indicating maximum detail level to profile.

integer indicating which timer to use. As defined in gptl.inc.
GPTLgettimeofday = 6 GPTLnanotime = 7 GPTLrtc = 8 GPTLmpiwtime = 9 GPTLclockgettime = 10 GPTLpapitime = 11
Stride to use for PIO tasks
Number of tasks to use for PIO
Type of output files for PIO
Root PE for PIO output processing
Flags for physics options with respect to how to handle input data.
File containing domain info.
Fill algorithm
Fill mask
Scalar mapping mask
Scalar mapping algorithm
Time interpolation algrorithm method
Input/Output (IO) type
Total number of tasks for IO
MPI rank of starting IO task
Ranks to skip for MPI IO tasks
MPI aggregator count
Character array of stream description file names
Character array of vector description file names
File containing tn460 correction factors (not valid for any CLM DATM7 modes)
If prescribed aerosols are coming from the data atmosphere model (datm)
Namelist filename for data model share stream data namelist
Decomposition type
Frequency to update radiation in number of steps (or hours if negative)
Master restart file name for datm model, needed for branch simulations, but currently unused
Stream restart file name for datm model, needed for branch simulations
Description of data source for datm input data.
Prescribed aerosol file name, full path
Prescribed aerosol initial year
Prescribed aerosol last year
Prescribed aerosol model year to align to first year
Beginning of year to cycle datm data through
End of year to cycle datm data through

CLM run type. 'default' use the default type of clm_start type for this configuration 'cold' is a run from arbitrary initial conditions 'arb_ic' is a run using initial conditions if provided, OR arbitrary initial conditions if no files can be found 'startup' is an initial run with initial conditions provided. 'continue' is a restart run. 'branch' is a restart run in which properties of the output history files may be changed.
Glacier model grid gland20 = Greenland at 20km resolution gland10 = Greenland at 10km resolution gland5 = Greenland at 5km resolution none = no glacier model grid
Horizontal resolutions
Source type of Nitrogen deposition data, when bgc=cn or bgc=cndv
Representative concentration pathway for future scenarios [radiative forcing at peak or 2100 in W/m^2] -999.9 means do NOT use a future scenario, just use historical data.
Land mask description

Year to simulate datasets for (such as surface datasets, initial conditions, aerosol-deposition, Nitrogen deposition rates etc.) A sim_year of 1000 corresponds to data used for testing only, NOT corresponding to any real datasets.

Range of years to simulate transitory datasets for (such as dynamic: land-use datasets, aerosol-deposition, Nitrogen deposition rates etc.) Constant means simulation will be held at a constant year given in sim_year. A sim_year_range of 1000-1002 or 1000-1004 corresponds to data used for testing only, NOT corresponding to any real datasets. A sim_year_range that goes beyond 2005 corresponds to historical data until 2005 and then scenario data beyond that point.
Namelist entries to demand be provided on the namelist.
Description of the use case selected.

Prescribed aerosol mode for the atmosphere model none = Don't pass aerosol from atmosphere, read it from inside of CLM (using faerdep) prognostic = Pass aerosol from a prognostic atmosphere model -- such as CAM. (may still be read in from a dataset in that model) pt1_pt1 = For datm use a single point dataset clim_1850 = For datm use constant 1850 conditions clim_2000 = For datm use constant 2000 conditions trans_1850-2000 = For datm use transient 1850 to 2000 conditions rcp2.6 = For datm use rcp=2.6 future scenario rcp4.5 = For datm use rcp=4.5 future scenario rcp6.0 = For datm use rcp=6.0 future scenario rcp8.5 = For datm use rcp=8.5 future scenario
Where dry deposition is calculated (from land, atmosphere, or from a table)
List of chemical constituents that dry deposition will be calculated for
